home.title: Startup Security Showdown
home.subtitle: Master Frontend Security Through Gamified Challenges
home.resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset your progress? This cannot be undone.

terminal.welcome: Welcome to the Startup Security Showdown!
terminal.researcher: You are a white-hat security researcher.
terminal.mission: Your mission: Find and exploit vulnerabilities before the bad guys do.
terminal.warning: Warning: This environment contains intentionally vulnerable code.
terminal.prompt: Ready to begin? Type 'start' to initialize the challenge environment...

features.realVulnerabilitiesDesc: Exploit actual security flaws found in production applications. Learn from real-world examples in a safe environment.
features.progressiveLearningDesc: Challenges increase in difficulty. Start with basic XSS and work your way up to advanced sandbox escapes.
features.interactiveDesc: Test your exploits in real-time. Get immediate feedback and detailed explanations for each vulnerability.
features.scoreCompeteDesc: Earn points for successful exploits. Compete with other security researchers on the leaderboard.
features.startupFocusedDesc: All scenarios are based on common startup technology stacks and security patterns you'll encounter in the wild.
features.safeLearningDesc: Practice ethical hacking in a controlled environment. No risk to real systems or user data.

footer.tagline: Built for security education ‚Ä¢ Practice ethical hacking ‚Ä¢ Stay curious üîí

domXss.title: DOM XSS - Feedback Form
domXss.signInMessage: Please sign in to access this challenge and track your progress.
domXss.briefingLine1: You've discovered a startup's customer feedback form.
domXss.briefingLine2: Initial analysis shows the form might be vulnerable to DOM-based XSS.
domXss.briefingLine3: Your goal: Find a way to execute JavaScript code through the feedback submission.
domXss.briefingWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is a controlled environment - exploit away!
domXss.successMessage: You successfully exploited the DOM-based XSS vulnerability!
domXss.whatYouLearned: What you learned: How unsanitized user input can lead to script execution
domXss.prevention: Prevention: Always sanitize user input and use textContent instead of innerHTML
domXss.realWorldImpact: Real-world impact: XSS can steal cookies, session tokens, and user data

jwtManipulation.title: JWT Token Manipulation
jwtManipulation.signInRequired: Sign in to access this premium challenge.
jwtManipulation.premiumLocked: Premium challenge locked. Upgrade to access.
jwtManipulation.briefingLine1: You've gained access to a startup's authentication system that uses JWT tokens.
jwtManipulation.briefingLine2: The system appears to have weak JWT implementation and validation.
jwtManipulation.briefingLine3: Your goal: Manipulate your JWT token to gain administrative privileges.
jwtManipulation.briefingWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Look for weak signature validation or algorithm confusion!
jwtManipulation.tokenPlaceholder: Paste and modify JWT token here...
jwtManipulation.vulnerabilityDetails: No signature validation + Client-side role checks
jwtManipulation.vulnerabilityDesc: The application trusts JWT payload without proper verification
jwtManipulation.successMessage: You successfully escalated your privileges by manipulating the JWT token!
jwtManipulation.whatYouLearned: What you learned: JWT tokens without proper signature validation can be manipulated
jwtManipulation.prevention: Prevention: Always validate JWT signatures server-side and never trust client-side tokens
jwtManipulation.realWorldImpact: Real-world impact: Privilege escalation, unauthorized access to sensitive data and functions
jwtManipulation.invalidSignatureAlert: ‚ùå Token signature validation failed. Edited tokens are rejected by the server.
jwtManipulation.authorizationFailedAlert: ‚ùå Authorization failed. Only the admin user can access admin functions.

authBypass.title: Authorization Bypass - Admin Panel
authBypass.signInMessage: Please sign in to access this challenge and track your progress.
authBypass.briefingLine1: You've discovered a startup's admin panel with weak authorization controls.
authBypass.briefingLine2: The application appears to rely on client-side authentication checks.
authBypass.briefingLine3: Your goal: Gain unauthorized access to the admin panel without proper credentials.
authBypass.briefingWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Look for client-side storage and validation weaknesses!
authBypass.hint1: The application stores authentication state in localStorage
authBypass.hint2: Admin privileges are checked client-side using browser storage
authBypass.hint3: Try using browser developer tools to modify localStorage values
authBypass.hint4: Look for the "isAdmin" key in localStorage and change its value
authBypass.loginToAccess: Please login to access admin panel
authBypass.clientSideBypass: Client-side authorization checks can be bypassed
authBypass.successMessage: You successfully bypassed the client-side authorization checks!
authBypass.whatYouLearned: What you learned: Client-side security controls can be easily manipulated
authBypass.prevention: Prevention: Always perform authorization checks on the server-side
authBypass.realWorldImpact: Real-world impact: Privilege escalation, unauthorized access to sensitive functions
authBypass.accessDeniedAlert: Access Denied: Admin privileges required. Only the admin user can access this panel.

openRedirect.title: Open Redirect Challenge
openRedirect.subtitle: Find and exploit the redirect vulnerability
openRedirect.signInRequired: Sign in to access this premium challenge.
openRedirect.premiumLocked: Premium challenge locked. Upgrade to access.
openRedirect.debugNotice: This field is visible due to debug mode being enabled in production
openRedirect.loginRejectedAlert: ‚ùå Login rejected: Invalid redirect URL. Only redirects to the same domain are allowed.
openRedirect.missingCredentialsAlert: Please enter both username and password
openRedirect.completionAlert:
üéâ Challenge Completed! üéâ

You earned {points} points!

You've successfully demonstrated how open redirect vulnerabilities can be exploited to redirect users to malicious external websites.
openRedirect.hint1: Look at the redirect parameter in the URL. What happens if you change it?
openRedirect.hint2: Try setting the redirect parameter to an external website like 'https://evil.com'
openRedirect.hint3: The application doesn't validate that the redirect URL belongs to the same domain
openRedirect.vulnerabilityDescription: The application accepts a redirect parameter without proper validation. This allows attackers to redirect users to external malicious websites.
openRedirect.scenarioStep1: 1. Attacker crafts malicious login link with external redirect
openRedirect.scenarioStep2: 2. Victim clicks legitimate-looking domain in email
openRedirect.scenarioStep3: 3. After login, victim is redirected to attacker's phishing site
openRedirect.scenarioStep4: 4. Victim enters sensitive info thinking they're still on the legitimate site

iframeSandbox.title: Iframe Sandbox Bypass
iframeSandbox.subtitle: Escape the sandboxed iframe environment
iframeSandbox.signInRequired: Sign in to access this premium challenge.
iframeSandbox.premiumLocked: Premium challenge locked. Upgrade to access.
iframeSandbox.sandboxWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Sandbox allows scripts but should restrict cross-origin communication
iframeSandbox.completionAlert:
üéâ Challenge Completed! üéâ

You earned {points} points!

You've successfully demonstrated how inadequate iframe sandboxing can be bypassed to communicate with the parent window.
iframeSandbox.hint1: Look at the iframe sandbox attributes. What's missing that would prevent script execution?
iframeSandbox.hint2: Try adding JavaScript code that attempts to communicate with the parent window using postMessage
iframeSandbox.hint3: The sandbox attribute 'allow-scripts' enables JavaScript, but 'allow-same-origin' allows postMessage communication
iframeSandbox.vulnerabilityDescription: The iframe uses sandbox="allow-scripts" but doesn't properly restrict cross-origin communication, allowing embedded content to communicate with the parent.
